replies.msg:
輿論戰，因為政府唔理香港人但在意國際形象
跟人認為一開始如果唔係612引到外國媒體報導
再616咁多人上街吸引更多外國媒體的話
林鄭應該由頭到尾都無諗過要出黎交代或道歉
我咁做無話一定有用
但宜家文宣組不斷寫信send去唔同媒體
我地最擅長用既武器係筆
所以希望盡最大既努力做得幾多得幾多

《金鐘事態概況目測》

截至咋日下午5點，
市民嘅合理訴求，仍然未得到正面回應。
面對正苦懶得理鳩你嘅態度，
用合理但不合作形式去催請，係勢在必行。

t.me/juneforstfuneral
為響應公海呼籲，我哋呢班大學生，
會喺今日朝早9點開始，
不間斷為同路人提供最新、最準確嘅第一手警察動向，
令您行動靈活自如，能夠安身立命，變中求勝。

烈士絕不能枉死，
自問係香港人，請您打贏呢場仗，用勝利去祭奠英魂。

終點未至，未可中止。
自己香港，自己救。

借黎做英文寫作練習, 不要介意
I am writing this letter to express my concern regarding the some reports from international media on the Hong Kong protests against the Extradition Law Amendment.

First, as a Hong Kong citizen who loves Hong Kong, I would like to thank you them and their readers for their attention. Your attention and support mean a lot to us. Hong Kong citizens truly NEED international help to pressure our government and police. The following is a short report of the four important aspects that show the real situation in Hong Kong that may differ from the ones portrayed by the international media might have been deceived or hidden from.

繼續借黎做英文練習

1. Chief Executive LIEDs to international media

The Chief Executive Carrie Lam has never withdrawn suspended the Extradition Law Amendment. Lam intentionally disinformed overseas journalist to spread rumors. WhileWhen Lam was responding responded to the 2-million-strong march on 16 June, she stated used the word “suspend” to overseas journalist in English. yYet the Chinese word was “暫緩” to citizens. “暫緩” is translated as “temporarily slowdown” in English, meaning the government just pauses its plan and can choose to resume it continue at any time. As there are still some international news reporting still states that as “Lam has mentioned withdrawal the very first time”, I want to clarify once again that the government has never withdrawn the amendment. In fact, the Lam has never responded to any of the requests raised by the protesters. Most of the protesters declare that their protest will continue vow to keep on protesting until Lam directly responds acquiesce to their four requests.

繼續借黎試下睇下點寫英文練習先, 但呢到冇track changes, 唔逐個較頻色了

改後文
2. Hospitals as an accomplice of the Hong Kong Police Force. Government's interference in the Hospital Authority’s system is a total violation of doctor-patient confidentiality.

The massive protests on 12 June resulted in a lot of injuries. Some injured protesters were arrested when they received treatment at public hospitals. The reason was that the Police could reportedly access the system of the Hospital Authority, the body managing public hospitals in Hong Kong, so that they could identify what they suspected to be protesters. Through the system, police officers could access personal information of patients, including identity card numbers, phone numbers, time of visits, dates and locations of admission. The relevant information was listed in a page called "Disaster Case List (Police)", which was said to be specifically designed for police access without the need for a password. With the information, the police are in a position to arrest suspects.

________________________

原文

2. Hospitals as an accomplice of the Hong Kong Police Force. Government's interference in the Hospital Authority’s system is a total violation of doctor-patient confidentiality.
Massive protests and arrest on 12 June resulted in a significant number of injuries. Injured protesters were however arrested during treatment in hospital as the police contrived to access patients information through the Hospital Authority’s system (HA). Injured protesters’ personal information, including identity card number, phone number, time, date and location of admission, were listed in a page called “Disaster Case List (Police)” in the HA Clinical Management System, which is created especially for police access without the system password. The police can easily access the information to arrest any potential suspect.

仍有一段未睇到, 練埋先

練習文

My concern is that protesters delay treatments, because they fear unreasonable arrests, although the police and hospitals may have violated basic human rights. This runs counter to the spirit of the medical services. Doctors are to adhere to the Hippocratic Oath, by which they should not harm patients. On a system level, the HA also has taken advantage of the trust of the citizens.

To protect our valued system, I sincerely hope that the international press and media will condemn the HA for being a accomplice of the police, and urge it to take remedial actions regarding its security.



原文

My concern is that the police and hospitals’ violation of basic human rights and injured protesters are delaying treatment due to fear of being arrested. Not only the HA has betrayed the trust of the citizens, but they also force their doctor to betray the Hippocratic Oath of not revealing the patient’s information without noticing. I sincerely hope that international press and media can help urge the HA to stop being the secret accomplice of the police and to strengthen the security of the system.

幫你推埋呢個post
加油

繼續第四篇改寫練習, 多謝提供材料

改文

3. INTENTIONAL MASS MURDER by Police

During the protests, Hongkongers have shown nothing but respect for medical personnel. The police, however, have shown otherwise. Even under the press coverage and in front of live streaming cameras, the police force stopped an ambulance with a severely injured citizen from leaving. Worse, it tried to arrest the patient on-site.

Furthermore, the police forced hundreds of peaceful protesters that protested in a legally approved area into a building called Citic Tower, and then seemingly attempted to trap the protesters with multiple rounds of tear gas.

The Police also unjustifiably attack and assault journalists and citizens. They did not give any prior notice before actions. This could be a violation of the Geneva Conventions, which protect everyone's basic human rights. In response, the Hong Kong Journalists Associations has lodged complaints. However, the attempts faced obstacles, because the identities of the police officers were unknown, as a result of the disappearance of their badge numbers on their uniform. Another answer given by the Independent Police Complaints Council, the body investigating improper behaviour of the police, was the paucity of complaints to initiate actions.

原文

3. INTENTIONAL MASS MURDER by Police

youtube.com
During the protest, Hongkongers have shown nothing but respect towards the medical workers. But the police have shown otherwise. Even under the monitoring of journalists and live streaming camera, the police force stopped an ambulance carrying a severely injured citizen and tried to arrest that patient as a suspect. The police also forced hundreds of unarmed protesters within a legal area (according to the Letter of No Objection) into the Citic Tower. The police force seemed to trap the protesters within a Gas-Chamber environment by marching from both exit direction.

The police were also questioned by their unjustified attack and assault towards the journalist and citizens without prior notice. All of these acts are a serious violation of The Geneva Conventions which protects our basic human rights. Regarding these outrageous act, the Hong Kong Journalists Association has filed different complaints. However, the Independent Police Complaints Council refuses to provide police badge numbers and insists that the council did not receive enough complaints to prompt their actions.

最後一篇寫作, 希望自己先用另一啲文字寫同一樣野

作文

4. Commissioner of Police accused protesters of breaching anti-rioting laws.

In several press conferences and broadcast speeches, both Commissioner of Police Stephen Lo and Chief Executive Carrie Lam insisted that the mass gathering on 12 June was a riot. They also denied any responsibility of the commanding the police to use violence..

Later on, though, Stephen Lo, announced that only five protesters are to be charged with rioting. The legal basis of this choice may not be sound. According to the Public Order Ordinance, it is impossible that only five protesters are charged with rioting within a zone of peaceful protests by more people. The reason is that legally speaking, when a protest is defined as a riot, "the persons assembled are riotously assembled". In other words, this legal definition may mean that the government could prosecute all the protesters who participated on 12 June with rioting. If that is the case, then they may face imprisonment lasing for at least five years. Even now, the government fails to provide a legal explanation on this matter.

Link to the Public Order Ordinance: https://www.elegislation.gov.hk/hk/cap245!en?xpid=ID_1438402885810_002&INDEX_CS=N


In regard to the unreasonable action of the government, the police, and Hospital Authority, the protesters have set a deadline (20 June 5 p.m.) for the government to directly respond to their four requests. As the deadline has already passed, the protesters are now upgrading their action so that their voice can be heard. I hope the international media can report the above problems and keep following Hong Kong protesters’ future actions. This is not just an internal affair of Hong Kong’s politics, but a movement about the defence of the basic human rights. Thank you once again for the international attention and support

原文

4. Commissioner of Police accused protesters of breaching anti-rioting laws.

In several press conferences and broadcast speeches, Commissioner of Police Mr. Stephen Lo and Chief Executive Carrie Lam insisted to define the mass gathering on 12 June as a riot and refused the responsibility of commanding police to use violence. Lo later announced that only five protestors will be charged with rioting. According to the Public Order Ordinance, it is impossible to single out the five protesters with rioting within a peaceful protesting. When the protest is defined as a riot, “the persons assembled are riotously assembled”. In other words, this definition will give the government a ground to prosecute all the protestors on 12 June with rioting. As long as they insisted their definition, the protesters arrested and those who might be arrested in the future can possibly be imprisonment for at least 5 years. Until today, the government cannot provide a lawful explanation regarding this matter.

Link of the Public Order Ordinance: https://www.elegislation.gov.hk/hk/cap245!en?xpid=ID_1438402885810_002&INDEX_CS=N

In regard to the unreasonable action of the government, the police, and Hospital Authority, the protesters have set a deadline (20 June 5 p.m.) for the government to directly respond to their four requests. As the deadline has passed, the protesters are now upgrading their action so that their voice can be heard. I hope the international media could report the above problems and keep following Hong Kong protesters’ future actions. This is not just an internal affair of Hong Kong’s politics, but a movement defending the basic human right. Thank you once again for the international attention and support
